dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to oval plate): 10.5 × 8 cm (4 1/8 × 3 1/8 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: In graphite, verso lower center: J.S.M (Lugt 1536)
inscribed:
In small outer margin at top center: [in reverse] HGoltzius fecit

Latin text presumably by Cornelius Schonaeus in margin around oval: [in reverse] VT CITO PRIMA FVGIT NASCENTIS GRATIA FLORIS, SIC HVMANA BREVI TEMPORE VITA FERIT. 

Dated between first and last word previous text: [in reverse] 1581

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932, Lugt 1536]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.

This portrait represents a gentleman of upper- and middle-class Netherlandish society. The innkeeper Allaert Fransz. Schatter’s medal emphasizes his central role in Haarlem’s civic culture. Goltzius places him in front of the Grote Markt, the town’s main square, with Schatter’s inn, the Orange Apple, visible over his right shoulder.
